div.span: Right Carotid Artery Stenosis and Left Common Carotid Occlusion
Complete occlusion, left internal carotid artery
Critical stenosis of the proximal internal carotid artery with intraluminal clot.
Occlusion of the left internal carotid. 50% lesion at the bulb and take-off of the right internal carotid (possibly ulcerated).
Carotid artery color doppler ultrasound: 80-90% stenosis of the proximal internal carotid artery secondary to large atherosclerotic plaques
Traumatic pseudoaneurysm and dissecting intramural hematoma of the cervical internal carotid artery.
